q: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
h:
“Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
h:
“Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
h:
“Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: I do not seek. I find.
h:
“I do not seek. I find.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
h:
“Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
h:
“Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.” —
Herodotus

q: Do not regret the past. Look to the future.
h:
“Do not regret the past. Look to the future.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Good entrepreneurs don't fail because they stay at it.
h:
“Good entrepreneurs don't fail because they stay at it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
h:
“The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Life is a journey, not a destination.
h:
“Life is a journey, not a destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
h:
“Associate with people who are likely to improve you. ” —
Seneca

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
h:
“If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?” —
John Wooden

q: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
h:
“Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
h:
“Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.” —
Euripides

q: If you find you are not valued and appreciated, then shift your attention to places where you will be valued and appreciated.
h:
“If you find you are not valued and appreciated, then shift your attention to places where you will be valued and appreciated.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
h:
“The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The more you give, the more comes back to you.
h:
“The more you give, the more comes back to you.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Some of your greatest lessons come from your darkest moments.
h:
“Some of your greatest lessons come from your darkest moments.” —
Roger Lee

q: I can think of nothing less pleasurable than a life devoted to pleasure.
h:
“I can think of nothing less pleasurable than a life devoted to pleasure.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.
h:
“If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.
h:
“Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.” —
Dan Millman

q: You can have it all. You just can't have it all at once.
h:
“You can have it all. You just can't have it all at once. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.
h:
“Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
h:
“When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: To live outside the law, you must be honest.
h:
“To live outside the law, you must be honest. ” —
Bob Dylan

q: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
h:
“No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
h:
“Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Everything you can imagine is real.
h:
“Everything you can imagine is real.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.
h:
“Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Obstacles don't block the path, they are the path.
h:
“Obstacles don't block the path, they are the path.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
h:
“Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.” —
W. Clement Stone

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:
“You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.” —
Stephen King

q: A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.
h:
“A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.
h:
“There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.” —
Huang Po

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
h:
“Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
h:
“The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
h:
“The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.
h:
“Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: We become brave by doing brave acts.
h:
“We become brave by doing brave acts.” —
Aristotle

q: It's beautiful to be alone. To be alone does not mean to be lonely. It means the mind is not influenced and contaminated by society.
h:
“It's beautiful to be alone. To be alone does not mean to be lonely. It means the mind is not influenced and contaminated by society.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
h:
“In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
h:
“Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Your past does not equal your future.
h:
“Your past does not equal your future.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.
h:
“Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated. ” —
Confucius

q: Imagination is the true magic carpet.
h:
“Imagination is the true magic carpet.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.
h:
“Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.” —
Paulo Coelho
